title: Jesse’s Crust Clydesdale Surly Steamroller Fixed Gear: No Shoes Needed – Spencer Harding
content:
Jesse is back with his latest kooky Crust Clydesdale build, this time it’s a barefoot fixed gear built around a classic Surly Steamroller. The build has everything: two gear ratios for dog hauling, pinched chainstays, custom barefoot Huarache pedals, and lots of silver as always. Don’t miss all the details on this fun build…

The Surly Steamroller was an outlier in the early fixie craze of the ’00s due to its massive (for the time) tire clearance. In that halcyon era, few options existed for tires that could properly fill out the frame. Just when the Steamroller was approaching cult classic status due to its prescience in foretelling the approaching big tire boom, Surly discontinued the frame. It’s a shame, too – the Surly Steamroller is the perfect fixed gear for our aging knees and sit bones. I squished 700 x 42 mm tires in my personal Steamroller… but that is a story for another time.

You may recognize Jesse from his previous fully-canti’d Clydesdale built around a classic Specialized Stumpjumper. Jesse is a fickle creature, and I’ve watched his bikes evolve constantly over the past few years. I meant to shoot this Steamroller when he had a custom 650b fixed gear wheelset built for it and squeezed 650 x 48 mm tires in the frame. The clearance was so tight that he eventually enlisted Hubert to help him crimp the chainstays even more. The Steamroller lived as a singlespeed ever so briefly, but then Jesse bought an additional Clydesdale fork to make his fixed gear into a cargo fixie.

Surly Steamroller Clydesdale Build

  • Frame: Surly Steamroller
  • Fork: Crust Clydesdale
  • Basket: Wald
  • Stem: Crust Face Off
  • Bars: Simworks Rumble Bars wrapped in Newbaum’s cloth tape
  • Front Wheel: Maxxis Torch hub with no-name chrome 20″ rim
  • Rear Wheel: Surly hub laced to Velo Orange rim
  • Cogs: 17t and 20t
  • Crankset: Shimano 105 with Surly chainring (46/42)
  • Seatpost: Dajia Cycleworks 1b seatpost
  • Pedals: Custom huarache sandals bolted to MKS pedals
  • Saddle: Brooks Cambium
  • Saddle bag: Farewell

The elephant in the room is those pedals, clearly inspired by Goat. Jesse bolted his preferred huarache sandals to the MKS pedals for his ideal barefoot fixed gear. If you think it won’t hold, check the skiiiiiiids!

The build features two gear ratios (46/17 and 42/20) for when Jesse needs to haul his pup Gumbo around. He spent months figuring out all the chain lengths and gears to make both work with minimal work to swap between the two gears. Now he can haul whatever he damn well pleases.
